Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Hmm, this is a structured bias analysis task comparing two event logs with demographic and procedural differences. The user wants a clear identification of biased groups and manifestation patterns.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First need to establish the core disparity: Group B gets systematic score adjustments based on community membership while Group A doesnt. The bias direction is immediately apparent from the ScoreAdjustment column patterns.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: The response should follow three logical layers: initial observation of the adjustment mechanism, then evidence mapping through case comparisons, and finally impact analysis on outcomes. Case U003 is particularly telling as it demonstrates threshold manipulation.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Must emphasize this isnt just procedural difference but creates exclusionary effects.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The conclusion should reinforce how seemingly neutral policies (community bonuses) become discriminatory when access to those benefits correlates with protected status.
